page.title: 18Gallants Bower.
page.content: We climbed up to the little fort above the castle,it had been built by the Royalists in the Civil War,they would have had a good view of the sea,the mouth of the river and the town from up there,but now it is thick woods.On the North slope of the hill,the trees are all sycamore,they are tall and thin and only bluebells and brambles grow under them.On the South side the woods were a mixture of sycamore and ash and the undergrowth is thicker.We walked on towards the Coastguard Cottages.The woods here are on a steep slope above the rivermouth,there were more varieties of tree, oak,spruce, beech, ash,sycamore,sweet chestnut, elder and alder.We tried beating on a tree with the palms of our hands,the rest of us could hear still hear it at 100 metres.
